defectData.description: Temperature control system malfunction caused uneven cooling at wafer edges

aiDiagnosis: Edge Die Failure caused by thermal stress during cooling phase
rootCauses: Temperature control system drift affecting edge cooling rates
Inadequate thermal management at wafer periphery
reasoning: Observed 85% of defects concentrated at edges (>0.8 radius)
Center region shows normal yield (60% premium)
Radial gradient pattern suggests thermal origin
High dead ratio (50%) indicates severe stress
Pattern matches thermal stress signature from equipment physics

defectData.spatialPattern: Defect cluster in central 30% of wafer

aiDiagnosis: Center particle contamination from spin coating process
rootCauses: Particle contamination in spin coating chemicals
reasoning: 75% of defects in center region (<0.3 radius)
Cluster detected at wafer center
Low overall failure rate (7.5%) suggests localized issue
Edge quality is normal, ruling out equipment-wide problem
Pattern consistent with particle deposition during spin process

reasoning: Extremely low failure rate (1%)

Uniform defect distribution (no concentration)

defectData.description: Catastrophic thermal shock during rapid temperature transition

rootCauses: Rapid temperature change exceeded material stress limits
Thermal ramp rate not properly controlled
Possible equipment malfunction in heating/cooling system
reasoning: Extremely high failure rate (61%)
Uniform distribution across wafer (not localized)
High dead ratio indicates catastrophic damage
Very low premium ratio (16.7%)
Pattern matches thermal shock signature

reasoning: Cluster detected in specific region (NE quadrant)

Localized pattern rules out process-wide issues
Moderate failure rate (10%) confined to one area
Spatial signature matches contamination event

reasoning: Uniform distribution (edge and center similar)

Pattern consistent with airborne particle contamination

defectData.description: Multi-stage failure: initial thermal stress at edges followed by contamination cluster
defectData.spatialPattern: High edge concentration PLUS cluster in SW quadrant

aiDiagnosis: Hybrid defect: thermal edge stress combined with contamination cluster
rootCauses: Primary: Edge thermal stress from cooling issues
Secondary: Contamination event created additional cluster
Multi-stage failure sequence over processing time
reasoning: UNIQUE: Both high edge concentration (65%) AND cluster detected
This differs from pure edge failures (no cluster)
Also differs from pure clusters (edge effect present)
Suggests timeline: thermal stress first, then contamination
Hybrid pattern indicates two separate failure mechanisms
uniqueFeatures: This is a rare hybrid pattern showing BOTH edge thermal stress signature AND a localized contamination cluster. Unlike pure edge failures, there's a secondary cluster in SW quadrant. This suggests a sequence of events rather than a single root cause.

defectData.description: Wafer warping caused gradual yield degradation from center to edge
defectData.spatialPattern: Gradual degradation with distance from center

aiDiagnosis: Wafer bow distortion creating gradual edge degradation
rootCauses: Film stress mismatch causing wafer warping
reasoning: Gradual edge degradation (60% edge concentration)
Much lower failure rate than thermal stress (7.8% vs 60%+)
Center quality good (61% premium)
Pattern shows progressive degradation, not sharp transition
Characteristic of mechanical bow rather than thermal shock

defectData.spatialPattern: Left side normal, progressive degradation toward right edge

reasoning: Left-right asymmetry in defect distribution
Progressive gradient pattern, not uniform
Moderate failure rate (8.3%)
Spatial pattern matches beam drift physics
Different from thermal or contamination patterns

Different from purely edge or center concentrated defects
